data.text:
2nd time at hickorys but 1st time at the wilmslow one, pretty much standard set out just like the poynton site.
Food was once again super tasty I did have the big mixed meat grill same as last time and was just as good, others had the sub sandwich which was really good didn't look the biggest tbh but for my mum it was perfect, partner had the steak which was nice and fairly priced again. Drinks prices are reasonable tbh and the service is always good. Not really an issue but personally I don't like service charge being added I prefer to leave a tip myself and tbf the service charge was a smaller percent than I would of tipped myself, not an issue just a personal thing. It does say on the receipt you can ask for the service charge to be removed but I feel that would be awkward, I guess it kind of guarantees they get a tip which I totally agree with but just like to do it myself. You deffo get what you pay for here and I do like the decor and set up of the place. We went at 14.45 and I heard the staff say this was the quiet time but it was still busy but had a nice atmosphere. Will deffo be going again some time soon

data.text: Been to the Poynton branch a couple of times before and not been blown away, but on a whim decided to give it another go for a birthday lunch. Have to say, it was excellent from start to finish. Service was friendly and prompt. We ordered the sharing platter and when we tried to order extras (eyes bigger than our stomachs) the server recommended we substitute items on the platter which was a nice gesture. Particularly enjoyed the brisket, which was tender and full of smoky flavour, and the fries, which were well seasoned and the right level of crispiness. The only criticism my wife and I could come up with was that the BBQ beans contained a bit too much meat, but really that's just splitting hairs. Genuinely delicious and great value for money, would heartily recommend it.
data.name: Simon Gill
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you so much for this fabulous review! We are so pleased to have exceeded your expectations and look forward to welcoming you back soon.

data.text: Nice staff and atmosphere. Felt really Christmasy and  like we were in the USA or Canada. The food was well sized, large portions but (due to my choices) a bit greasy. This was due to lots of batter and probably not the cleanest of cooking oil. I'm not faulting the staff of even the menu, but rather advising others - if you get heartburn avoid the fried chicken and onion rings. I would definitely visit again and choose the steak or burger.

data.text:
Went as party of six on a weekday night at 5:30 (so quite early) for daughter's birthday. This place has some great themed decor inside. The staff are amazingly polite and attentive and made loads of fuss of her for her birthday, which she loved!

The food... Oh yes it is amazing. A carnivore's delight. I had the platter for one and the brisket and ribs just melted. The amount of food was just about right - I didn't have room for a pudding but that's no big deal for me. Others also really enjoyed their mains. Dessert was also great with my son having the waffles.

The only niggle of the evening wasn't really the restaurant's fault and will make me sound a bit grumpy... I cannot stand it when parents just let their kids run riot in restaurants, no matter if they are family friendly. Because of when we ate, the place was full of kids who were constantly in and out of some doors to the outside that backed onto the bench that we sat at such that the doors were slamming into us pretty much every minute for first half hour or so. Luckily it calmed down and I don't think the kids really noticed this... Just my old-fashioned ways and, had it not been for this, would have awarded 5*.

Would definitely come again but later on when the kids are in bed!

data.text:
Server was ignorant, arrogant and not very good at serving and then clearly deliberately chose not to hand us the feedback device as he knew that he'd let your team down (callum, on Monday evening,  about 7pm?).

He also had a bit of an odd, awkward conversation about having to explain to us about a manager having been sacked recently, which was in relation to him having served us a few weeks before.

All in all it was dissapointing from the start including the choice of table/seating we were taken to where there other options surely available at the time. The room at the front where we were was quite loud and not very relaxing, in fact we had other diners walking past on their way to the toilets,  staring at our food and being nosey because the tables were poison close together.

Our 8th or 9th visit to a Hickorys restaurant between the family members present on Monday but unfortunately the worst experience so far.

data.text:
Can‚Äôt fault the food, it was delicious as usual.
I have a couple of little complaints. Upon booking I was asked for special requests in which I informed them it was one of our guests 30th Birthday and we wanted to be sat near the cinema room as we had our 4 year old child with us who loves the cinema room and often taken in her food to eat in there. When we arrived we were asked to wait for 5/10 minutes whilst the guests before paid their bill, which we had no problem doing. We were then asked if our 4 year old would be ok on a higher chair to which we said no as I knew she wouldn‚Äôt like the high chair. So after declining this we were sat in the garden room instead, which whilst is a beautiful room it is on the other end of the restaurant to the cinema room so my daughter could not walk to and from there by herself, hence she did not get to go in until the end of the meal otherwise one of us adults would‚Äôve spent the meal eating alone. We did asked to be moved but was told it would be 30 minutes wait.
Also nothing was done for the 30th Birthday, usually they put up a little sign or something.
This wouldn‚Äôt deter us from returning but I think I will ring up to book next time rather than online.

data.text:
I ordered the bacon muffin with the tots. It was really good, a decent sized portion as well. I really like the tots but for me they are just a tad bit on the spicy side. I also ordered rhe blueberry and maple smoothie type drink. It was interesting, if you don't mind drinking maple then I would recommend it. I would say there was too much ice in it so order without!
My partner ordered steak and eggs. The steak was supposed to be rare. It came out medium to well. We sent it back and I think the manager came over to apologise with was all fine. The issue was that the re-cooking of the steak took way too long and it still wasn't to his liking but by this point he just accepted it because I had already finished my meal and my 1 year old was getting bored. There was also a lack of flavour in the steak.

I would recommend coming here as we have been here before and had no issues. I just probably wouldn't recommend getting the steak if you are quite particular with the way it is cooked.

Food was good (chips a little cold) and atmosphere was good. But service was bad. Waited ages to clear mains (to the point where we was the last table there but the staff seemed to be having fun behind the bar) I had to ask for someone to clear the table, as it was a big party so there were a lot of plates. Went to pay and the machines weren‚Äôt working (not their fault at all) but I paid for the table which was a large amount and waited to see if it had gone through (because of the temperamental machines) and all the staff scattered and left me standing at the bar waiting until some gentleman came over and asked if everything is okay. To my reply ‚Äúyes, just waiting for them to tell me it‚Äôs gone through fine‚Äù. To which he replied ‚Äúhave they all just walked off?‚Äù
Yes. Yes they did all just walk off in a group.

data.text:
Very American vibe with a paneled decor, flannel shirts and smoky meat. If you've never been before, this is standard fare: burgers, fajitas, steaks and ribs, with some less familiar north-American dishes like poutine and corn dogs.

Expect massive portions and long waits if you're going as the place is busy. They put kitchen roll on every table to clean up your sticky fingers and the table service is good with regular check-ins.

One last thought: don't order a milkshake before your meal. They're like a meal unto themselves and will thoroughly ruin your appetite.

Recommended.

First time I‚Äôve visited  the Wilmslow branch, i usually go to the one in  poynton.

It‚Äôs my first visit to hickory‚Äôs since two years ago and first of all the dishes are not as good as they used to be , beef brisket are not the same how they used to be cut in long slim pieces there now small chunks and found them pretty fatty .

The food though was ok, what ever you do don‚Äôt sit near the cinema room it‚Äôs chaos  , kids running round screaming in and out the cinema too. Where we was sat , kids crawling round the floored . I hate to single out service staff as I know this industry has took a massive hit and 90% off all restaurants are probably massively under staffed so are probably over worked but when your food is served and you haven‚Äôt been given enough knifes and forks and have to go asking for them is pretty poor standards as it‚Äôs a simple thing they should be sorted before you take your seat  , then 2 of the 4 drinks come and I had to go chasing my drinks again simple things bring all the drinks in one go. Probably won‚Äôt ever return as don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs worth the money for the service you get or the food you get .

We had a lovely meal in a great atmosphere. The staff were beyond helpful, and our son was entertained by the Disney pixar cinema at the back of the restaurant. We really enjoyed the food, including the share platter and several starters, which were all delicious.

The staff were very helpful and knowledgeable of the menu, and our waiter was actually excited to hear it was our first visit there, and fully explained the menu and the way the meat is prepared and cooked. We felt very welcome and comfortable as soon as we sat down. (James I think it was, a credit to your restaurant!)
We walked past 4 staff members on the way out, all of which thanked us for coming and said goodbye, excellent hospitality. Just a point that this is not something I expect normally, especially nowadays, but it was a noticeable gesture and they all seemed genuine when they said it.

Would definitely return!

data.text: Came last night for tea and I am not one to leave reviews but this place deserves it. We drove half an hour to come here wanting to try somewhere new and seeing the previous good reviews. Portion sizes were generous and look as good as they taste. Drinks menu is brilliant. American import drinks give you new drinks to try at reasonable prices and my god the milkshakes are immense. The biggest thing that gets me writing a review is the customer service. It‚Äôs not often you go somewhere where every single member of staff is so welcoming and attentive. From the waitresses/waiters to the lads behind the bar, they all can‚Äôt do enough for you and really make it worth while. Will 1000% be back here again soon and will recommend to everyone

data.text:
This is the meat lovers Mecca.

A true American style smokehouse atmosphere created by music, smell, drink selection and not forgetting the very friendly staff.

The food was very tasty, great value for money and the service was quick, but not so that you felt rushed out the door.

We'll definitely go back. Especially with the regular offers they have through the week.

Thanks team, a brilliant experience.

data.text:
We have been to Hickory‚Äôs now on several occasions and as a family, we love it!

There is no shortage of choice with something for everyone. The only problem we have is deciding between the wonderful options they offer! The ‚ÄòChicken fried waffle‚Äô, ‚ÄòTexas-style beef brisket‚Äô and ‚ÄòEight-hour smoked smoked beef rib‚Äô are particular favourites of ours along with the ‚ÄòMagic-dusted fries‚Äô, ‚ÄòClassic corn dogs‚Äô and the so wrong but so right ‚ÄòFrickles‚Äô! The desserts are great (if you have any room left) but the staff will happily box up leftovers for you to take home.

The ‚ÄòHickory‚Äôs cloudy lemonade‚Äô is cool and refreshing as is having ‚ÄôLagunitas IPA‚Äô on draught. If you‚Äôre one for cocktails, ‚ÄòThe game changer!‚Äô is a great, although morish choice.

The atmosphere is buzzing and the service is great, never had a problem. Sit in the indoor/outdoor area for a quieter atmosphere.

Pricing isn‚Äôt cheap but is fair and reasonable for the quality, as with the old saying, you get what you pay for and here it‚Äôs certainly money well spent.

data.text:
Totally LOVED this place! The atmosphere, looks of the place, kindness of the staff, menu, food quality and quantity, all straight perfect! I pushed my luck by going without reservation. Parking lot was completely full and place looked packed but luckily they still had a table in the bar section where I got served without any problems. Ideal place for both families and solo (business) travelers like me. Nobody will look weird at you for opening your laptop at the table. Loved it.

Their WiFi requires complicated logging in to social media and giving scary consents. Avoided using it. Pity that they have set it up this way.

Only negative point, if I have to mention something, would be that they add tip for themselves to the bill already without asking or informing. That doesn't feel right. Luckily the service was good enough to deserve a tip, but already assuming it is inappropriate.

Response to the owner response:
I have read the standard reply on the tipping with other reviews already. You know it WILL be awkward to ask for it to be removed anyway, especially because you're tossing in some charity. I still think it's inappropriate to handle this way, regardless of the story you provide with it.
data.name: Koen Zomers
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Koen, thank you for taking the time to leave your review.

I'm glad to hear your enjoyed dining with us, I'll ensure your comments get passed back to the teamüôÇ 

We have added a discretionary 7.5% to the tip jar, all of it goes to the team that have looked after you plus a contribution to our nominated charity 'Cash for Kids' - If you‚Äôd prefer not to tip, just ask & we‚Äôll take it of without any awkwardness. 

We do hope to see you again soon. 

Best wishes, 
Alex

data.text: We turned up, as we did not book, and was greeted by Alex, who placed us in a fantastic area for my fianc√©es birthday, her mum and myself, I mentioned briefly to Alex it was my fianc√©es birthday and conversed friendly with me, my fianc√©e and her mum. Really great from the start, then we met Sophie who was looking after our menu orders and drinks by Alex, I have to say even though they were short staffed and the restaurant was pretty steady they took the time to have a decent conversation With us, and never looked dismissive or stressed and that meant the world to us. Could have spoken to Sophie and Alex all day. This was the first time we had ever been to Hickory Steakhouse and I was blown away by the level of service and conversation we had received, a lot could be learned from these 2, it really could. We loved it. The food and drinks were out of this world, it was above and beyond my expectation particularly we just turned up no booking. And to top it off Alex and Sophie sent a desert and candle right at the end, which we certainly didn‚Äôt ask for, and this was a beautiful touch to finish what was one of my best experiences in a restaurant. Great work Alex & Sophie, perfect really was and thank you

data.text:
I‚Äôd you are ever local to hear GO GO GO!! You won‚Äôt regret it best restaurant we‚Äôve ever been to!

We came to Manchester from Kent, booked here as we wanted to try a smokehouse and what a first time experience!

The staff from the moment you walk in the door are friendly, welcoming, talkative the atmosphere as a whole throughout the restaurant was spot on!

We sat and had a few drinks before food - the drinks menu 10/10 amazing! Than the food! We were served by a lovely lady called Dan she was very helpful and friendly. We waited minimal time for food and it was incredible, the flavours, the cooking time the texture everything 10/10! Also love the popcorn touch!

Before we left we were chatting with a guy called James- believe he was front of house not sure but again he made us feel really welcomed and was explaining the history behind how hickory‚Äôs started and their plans for the future.

Thank you so much for incredible service food and all round experience, would drive back to wilmslow just for this place!

10/10

A really great restaurant with good atmosphere, food and service.

Hickories is a very well decorated and wonderfully staffed restaurant serving great food at very reasonable prices.

I had the ‚Äòhog heaven‚Äô (only served on Tuesdays) which was a brilliant taste of many of the BBQ flavours, the wings were particularly delicious. For only ¬£12 it‚Äôs a bargain. I also highly recommend their lemonades, the blueberry and grape sodas were especially refreshing.

Service was prompt and friendly and Dan behind the bar was excellent during a milkshake making course.

Will be returning soon!

data.text: Ok so I've been going from gastro pubs to other family friendly places and let me tell you that this is by far the best . Food is smokehouse southern US so ribs, baby back,briskets but also lots of various burgers,po boy, gumbo's etc. The mains tastes great,are generous, and the price is the same as a standard boring pub. In a nutshell great value for money. The atmosphere is really good with nice lighting, great US country/bluegrass type music in the background,lots of drinks to choose from. And if you have younger kids and they finish earlier than you their meals,there is a cinema room where they will get popcorn and watch a kids movie(Toy Story 4 in our case). Only very slightly minus point,the service from waitress was average (not really smiley) but I'm picking. Food comes out fast too . Loved it!!! 5 stars!!

data.text:
I came up to Wilmslow for a 3 day training course and stayed in the Premier Inn next door. I initially came here for ease, but the quality of service and food on night one meant I had to return the following night and the night after.
Brisket and chicken waffles were top drawer and great value.
I was meant to be travelling home the following night but the cold snap froze my car battery, leaving me with a 7 hour wait for the AA to jump-start me. The kindness of everyone at Hickory's was amazing; regularly checking on me and the AA's progress, asking around for jump leads, keeping me warm, and keeping me company. The flat battery had every chance of ruining a great few days but it only enhanced it down to the personable and thoughtful team.
Absolute credit to themselves. I will be returning as soon as possible.

data.text:
My partner and I had lunch at Hickory‚Äôs for the first time and brought our dog too, because of this we had to sit in the outdoor seating area which was absolutely no bother to us at all. They left blankets on the tables and turned the outdoor heaters on for us, and we were made to feel extremely welcome.

The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive and they even brought out a big juicy piece of beef brisket for our little dog (I‚Äôm a vegetarian and I can‚Äôt lie, it smelt amazing, proper quality meat.)

They have a separate gluten free menu with a wide range of choice, and when receiving the food, the staff even went to the effort to tell us they‚Äôve double checked that it‚Äôs allergen friendly and clearly marked the food with ‚Äòallergy‚Äô cocktail sticks for extra peace of mind.

We left very full and very happy and can‚Äôt wait to return again.
Ps. TRY THE ONION RINGS.

Really good service, friendly confident, knowledgeable staff.

Venue a bit too loud for an adult group booking - we couldn't really hear each other talk unless we really leaned in. Partly that was due to there being a live singer on for the first hour or so of our booking. Which was nice but not what we'd expected for a sit-down dinner.  Venue nicely decorated, laid out and comfortable otherwise.

Food - okay, not amazing. Presentation and dish composition pretty poor.  Accompaniments (pickles etc) served up on disposable paper trays is not impressive, it just screams corner-cutting, which is unforgivable at mid-range prices.

This is the 2nd time visiting and I can honestly say I won‚Äôt be returning. We had a table booked for 7.30pm and the lady who greeted us said our table wasn‚Äôt ready and to have a drink at the bar. We waited 15 minutes but then noticed people coming in were going straight to their tables. When I went back to ask if our table was ready she asked our name again, and then went away, we was clearly forgotten about.
We were then taken to our table which was right next to the children‚Äôs cinema room, biggest mistake ever. Children were left to run round the restaurant all night being extremely noisy whilst their parents sat happily on their tables at the other side of the restaurant. This place feels like an unorganised cr√®che than a restaurant.
Food was nice, waitress seemed a little uninterested and everything seemed an effort for her.
Won‚Äôt be returning anytime soon.

data.text:
My elderly parents booked a table in advance Monday and requested to be seated in the garden room however when we arrived we were told we couldn't be seated in there as there was no room! However there were lots of empty seats but he refused to let us sit there and put us on a table in the middle of families and young children who were running about. Extremely unprofessional behaviour from the manager who had no people skills.
My parents had driven from Wales and myself and my friend had come from Nottinghamshire. We hadn't seen them since July and they booked as a treat for us all. They have eaten there many times before and booked having requested to sit  in the garden room. The manager's behaviour was poor he made no attempt to help or offer us any compromise.
The meals all came out separate then they dropped my dad's meal. My neices hot dog came out then 10mins later her side orders arrived! Not good enough from a well know company such as Hickorys.
My Mum was very upset by the way we were treated.
The manager was totally out of order he offered no apology. On our way out the garden room still wasn't full and chairs had been added to tables where he told us they couldn't. Our faces just didn't fit.
Poor

data.text:
Somewhere a little different.
It's a large, fresh, airy, and well decorated American style restaurant. The building and decor brings a lot of character to the place.

The menu features a number of different types of steak, ribs, chicken, hot dog, burgers and fish dishes. They have specialty days: Mon -Thurs eg Hotdogs on Tuesday... something else on Weds, etc...

We decided because we were in a bit of a rush, so we sat in the bar area and selected appetisers of the menu.

The staff were welcoming on arrival and friendly throughout. Had a laugh with one of the bar staff, who got me to do the Pepsi Challenge and I nailed it! Get in!

We ordered the Ribs, chicken wings in bourbon sauce and skinny fries. It cost ¬£19 and was delicious! It took about 10mins for the food to arrive which was good. The food was delicious!

The steaks on the menu vary in price. The menu is available online.

There's plenty of parking. The restaurant is just near the Lindow Common.

Overall, highly recommended when uou have saved a few quid. It's not cheap but I feel its worth it!

data.text:
Where to start? Having been to the glorious Hickory's in Chester, on the River Dee for a first date with my fiancee a fair few years ago in 2017.. I thought it would be a good recommendation for the family to celebrate my birthday here. As it was fairly local for my family coming from Rochdale and Runcorn.

Having seen the reviews I thought great, food will be the same quality. Service will be top notch.

We have a family of 9 including my 87 year old nan and 5 month old son, so a good range of ages. We called up about 7 weeks ago to book for July 23rd (my birthday was 9th) it was fully booked up, I thought no problem table of 9 must be a difficult one to manage to squeeze in...we were told a 6 week wait on a party this size...so rebooked for this evening (6/8/22)
After excitedly leaving work early and picking up my family and meeting the rest at the restaurant at 7 for our table.

We were met with what I can only describe as someone looking like the most stressed out man I've ever seen managing seating arrangements. The guy had a beard, couldn't read if he had a name badge but there wasn't a "Welcome to Hickory's" in there. Which would have been nice.

The place was packed out, car park full. I thought brill looks like a good atmosphere. A young worker then brought us over to the table and asked halfheartedly "who's birthday is it?" I said "mine but rather belated"...a very insincere "happy birthday" followed as we were shown the seat.
Next we were greeted by a third worker who asked the same question...same reaction...same again. I thought "wow does anyone get excited here? It's a BBQ place and it's busy let's go, let's make it exciting no?!" .......There was however a chalkboard pig with happy birthday scribbled on it.

We awaited the rest of the family to turn up but ordered drinks...after a while and everyone had got a drink we ordered. A fair few meals totalling nearly ¬£300 for the bill.
The food was... okay...I've had better at tru reds BBQ in Leeds and Manchester and this was a gut punch as I'd recommended this place to the family. My sister's ribs were full of fat, hardly any meat. My father's and my sharing platter looked like it had stood for 20 minutes before it landed at the table, I couldn't explain what the beans and pulled pork looked like, but it would have been at home on a food meme page.

I tried to stay positive (after all I do adore the Hickory's pale ale, the only saving grace). My fianc√©e's brisket meal didn't even turn up and we had to ask where it was... our server had to go fetch it that was 5 minutes later..

In the backdrop I can hear all sorts of happy birthdays from the team to other customers, groups of maybe 4 or 5. We waited maybe something might happen...nope. It appeared we were forgotten about. Hard to think really when we were a massive table ready to enjoy a good evening, seated right near the bar, wedged in together. It took us 2 hours  from sitting down, to eating, to being offered a dessert menu...even that was an effort for our server. Fast forward to 930 and I had to get up and ask for the bill.
A service charge of 7.5% totalling nearly ¬£20 was added....now usually I am happy to slap on a bit more if I am wowed by the service, as I work in the customer service industry as a jeweller. I expect good service wherever I go. I value good service, I'll pay for good service. Not mind blowing, but just someone to go out of their way with one thing...this time around everything seemed disorganised, unpolished and poor service wise, so we took the charge off the bill.

If the food would have matched my previous experience I'd have scored higher. But the fact I couldn't even find the floor manager to pass on my feedback showed me exactly why the experience tonight fell so far short of my previous experience at Chester and my expectation.

As birthday meals go it's one to forget and I'm still frustrated I suggested it.

A shame really as I'd heard good things about this place.
data.name: James Hoxworth

HI James,

Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us your feedback.

Best wishes,
Alex

data.text:
I need more than five stars for our experience with you last night. We booked to come for my daughter's 8th birthday. When you go to most other restaurants you're lucky to even get a 'happy birthday' out of them. Hickory's is a whole different story. She was given her own sign so everyone who came to the table knew, so every staff member who came to us acknowledged it. Food, drinks and service at the bar and table were all absolutely spot on. And to top it all off, she got invited behind the bar to make her very own milkshake with a very patient member of the bar team. Thank you to the lovely lady that waited on us and everyone else that made it so special. It absolutely made her day ‚ô•Ô∏è

Visited again today and were looked after by Josh. Thank you for being so welcoming and looking after us so well. Hickory's really are showing a lot of other restaurants that great food and great service really is still possible! We were sat in a lovely booth, next to the cinema. Kids had a blast. Can't wait to visit again! üòÉ

data.text:
A respectable chain of restaurants that specialises in smokehouse cuisine.

Most of their food is quite rich and salty, so consider only ordering small meals as my usual volume of food nearly caused me to have a medical episode.

The southern fried chicken in a basket is wonderful, although they slightly overcooked it here.

I also went for their platter for one and although most of it was good, so choices were a bit weird, like sticking the gherkin being in the coleslaw and causing that to separate a bit.

It's very popular and loud, which is something to consider when taking people who are on the autistic spectrum.

It was my first time in Hickorys in Wilmslow but I have been to Chester one few times and I must admit the is a big difference in food quality. Generally, food was ok- just ok. Nothing to rave about at all as it wasnt even properly hot. We have ordered starters and while we were in the middle of eating it the main arrived... slightly annoying as I like to have (at least) a little breather before the main. Anyway rest of the starters were packed to take home. The girl serving us was great and attentive and she has made the difference.
Next time it will be Chester, sorry..

data.text: Stopped off for dinner on bank holiday Sunday and fortunately we were able to get a seat in the bar area without a reservation. Generally the service was good and one of our friends is gluten free and they were very happy with the choice of food on offer. Only improvements would be that I asked for a full fat coke and they brought Pepsi max (did replace with a bottle of coca cola after I mentioned this), there was a peice of plastic in the lettuce of my wife's fajitas and the waiter didn't bring cutlery so we had to ask for this after all the food was presented. Overall a good experience, food was cooked well and tasted great. We could see how busy the restaurant was, however service still seemed to be swift and we didn't find ourselves waiting for food / drinks too long at any point.
data.name: Matthew Gentles
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi Matthew, thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback on your recent visit to us. I can only apologise that we have let you down with a few of the basics on this occasion. I do hope this has not put you off in the future as I know we can do so much better than this. If you like to discuss your visit further, please drop us an email to hello@hickoryswilmslow.co.uk üôÇ

data.text: Took ages for someone to take our order and to get the bill...just small things, but massively impacts the dining experience. Felt like the staff were too busy chatting to each other rather than checking the guests were okay. The chicken was so dry too! Disappointed because the hickory smokehouse in Chester is amazing.

data.text:
Can I just explain something and the reason for my low review, I had no issue with the food, the service started well tonight but the attention to clearing the plates was an extremely long time, what had really upset me is the fact without discussion you automatically add to the bill a tip for your staff, I automatically paid the bill without checking as I just put my card down and the waitress took the money including the tip charge.

I usually tip in restaurants at my discretion and when I feel I want to.

adding ¬£10 to my bill without discussion, to me is not acceptable.

The Bill for for was ¬£128.00

THIS WAS NOT MADE CLEAR ON ENTRY OR ANY POINT AT THE TABLE.

I left feeling annoyed, I personally feel this should not be the case and the charge should be refunded immediately

I understand you serve American food but this is Crewe Uk not the USA

Please have it arranged to have this credited please

data.responseFromOwnerText:
Thank you for your feedback, we are sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your meals.

data.text: Great venue. Authentic inside and out. Friendly team. Quick service especially for starters (and kids meals if asked for at the same time). Nice to see a venue with Children‚Äôs cutlery (a rarity these days) with kids packs on the table ready for use. Food was fresh and hot and portion sizes are American and big. Good luck to anyone wanting starter, main and desert. The only letdown for me was the milkshakes, as they‚Äôre more foamy than milkshakes. Anyone travelling with a baby be aware the family toilets upstairs don't have a baby change table. We found out after the baby change is downstairs but all the signs for the bathrooms are for upstairs.

Unbelievable experience. The food and service was great.
Unfortunately my little girl had a bad cough and a popcorn went the wrong way.  She had a fit of coughing. One of the staff came over calmly to check we were ok. Really wish I had taken their names but both ladies did a great job.
Thank you
Even the dog we had with us was well looked after with some nice treats to keep her happy.

data.text:
Visited on Mother's Day - booked in advance of a table of 7 and had to rearrange for an early time slot which was approved by the staff as we needed to be out by 8:00PM. On arrival there was plenty of parking space and the lot was presently clean and no litter in sight. However, there seemed to be a great towed vehicle at the entrance which was probably from the attached Premier Inn next door.

On entering the venue, there was hand sanitizer available but no present information on the percentage of alcohol in the sanitizer. We were greeted fairly immediately but were told that our table was not available yet despite being on time and calling ahead. We were told to wait at the bar, for drinks and we would be told when our table would be ready 20 minutes passed and after seeing smaller parties being seated a member of staff (unknown role) told us that we would be compensated for the wait with a free round of drinks. Another 10 minutes passed and would be told that our seat is ready.

The venue was understandably busy due to Mother's Day. It was clear that the staff were very attentive to the guests but not to the floor space, there was some food debris on the floor that was not cleared up and was being kicked around by the kids running around.

We were told that a certain server would take care of us during our stay. Another server by another name was actually our acting server for the night. The drinks and popcorn was great from our experience and the food came very quickly. The quality of food was only slightly above average and for the price we had paid, it was justifiable.

Overall, we left around 8:20 after waiting for the bill. The tipping system implied for the servers may be something other guests might need to look at. It is automatically added to the bill. The experience was good for the time and circumstances on the night. More could be done to improve the overall experience for me to fully recommend this place.

6/10.

data.text:
Since I‚Äôve driven past Hickory‚Äôs quite a few times and seeing the car park always full, I had to book in as soon as I knew I was staying in the area! Safe to say I understand now why it‚Äôs always full! The drinks menu is so varied as it has a full bar, from beers, wine, gin, cocktails, milkshakes and non-alcoholic beverages. I had a peach iced tea, expecting a small glass (as most places provide when ordering a non-alcoholic drink), but when it came it was a huge mason jar - I was already impressed! When the mains came, the meat was so tender that my partner used a fork to simply slide the meat off of the rib, it was so juicy that he‚Äôs only set himself up for failure if he ever orders that from anywhere else. The desserts were insane too, very American-style fro-co (frozen custard) which blew my mind, and my partner had waffles (never seen him consume something so fast with the threat of me trying to steal some). Overall, the price and speed of service were perfect, I definitely will be visiting again.
The only negative for me as a vegetarian was the lack of choice for myself, however, it is a smokehouse and a meat haven, so I knew I wasn‚Äôt going to have much choice.

data.text: Had an absolutely fantastic experience here yesterday on 21/12/21. data.text: Took mum, as we didn't know what we fancied, and we haven't been in since it changed from the Boddington Arms to the Smokehouse. The gluten free menu was reasonable, although slightly limited because mum doesn't do chilli at all, but we both opted for the pulled pork with beans. Wow! I must say it was the best surprise in a long time in terms of ambience, decor and food. The staff were on the ball about the gluten free side and we loved the ree popcorn and bottled water whilst we browsed the menu. It's not the cheapest out there, but it compares reasonably with others in Wilmslow and we will definitely be back!

Amazing. There's literally hundreds of American-style restaurants who try and fail at being authentic.

Hickory's isn't one of them. It really feels like you're in the States not just from the look and feel of the restaurant but the food is absolutely first class.

This is the part where others fall flat, but Hickory's stands above with its wings spread out proud like the American Bald Eagle.

data.text:
Have been here twice now and have got to say this is now going to be my wife and I's new favourite date night restaurant! We've got a booking to come again this weekend for lunch!

The first time it was just the two of us a couple of weeks ago, we came around lunchtime when it was nice and quiet. We had two servers (I'm really sorry we can't remember your names now) A young lad who was new and in training and a lady who was shadowing/training him. They were both fantastic hosts, talked us through the many gins they have (over 40!) and had some good laughs and banter with! The food was served promptly and was delicious! (bbq chicken for my wife and the ribs for me) and the measures in the drinks also generous! Bless his heart the young lad even gave us a couple gin+lemonades on the house for being friendly and patient with him as we finished up to leave. We hope he's doing well!

The second time was Friday evening just gone, we came back with a close friend of ours who we haven't seen in over 18 months thanks to covid. It was a bit busier than before but that didn't hurt our service at all. This time we both went for the bird and beast burger and my goodness I don't think I've ever put something so delicious into my mouth before. Who'd have thought a hash brown would be the perfect accompaniment to a beef and chicken burger?

Oh and as a bonus, you get free fresh popcorn to nibble on while you wait! 10/10 would definitely recommend Hickory's and their staff to everyone. See you again soon team!

data.text:
Visited with my partner tonight as we had never been to a smokehouse before.
First and foremost the staff are all fantastic, the customer service we received was ace.
2ndly the chefs deserve massive massive credit, we sat at the bar next to what I assumed was meat prep. The chef offerd us some tasters which we couldn't refuse and it really set the standard for what was coming out food wise.
The drinks came and I'm not a massive drinker but I could neck those cocktails all day long. The bartenders clearly know what there doing and it shows.
Back onto food and it was just amazing again massive hats off to the chefs at this venue you guys really shocked me.
Over all I'm very very impressed with the staff and venue. These guys tick every box that you expect to be ticked in hospitality venue and given they've had to endure months of restrictions it was really nice tk see the venue bouncing with happy customers. Myself and my partner will definitely be back and we will both recommend to anyone in the area who fancies some good food and cracking service.
Cheers guys :)

data.text: Oh my ! We loved this place from the greeting as we arrived to the time we were leaving every member of staff was smiley cheerful and extremely helpful. Thank you to all the staff . I would highly recommend a vast you won't be disappointed x

data.text:
We went for date night and didn't even have half ares drinks before walking out because when we ordered food we were sat opposite the grill and saw the chef wipe his nose and sweaty forehead on his gloves and then picked food up and put it on someone's plate and didn't even wash his hands or change his gloves.
So we got up and told the manager what we had witnessed for hygiene this is shocking and the chef should know better especially when the open grill is on show to everyone sat in that area.
Definalty won't be going back
